did.unittitle: Mansfield (Connecticut) League of Women Voters Records

repository.corpname: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries

did.abstract: The materials that compose the records of the Mansfield League of Women Voters in this collection begin with minutes documenting a meeting that took place on 5 February, 1942. As the League gained strength in membership and purpose the records of its activities have included: organizational documents such as histories of the League, by-laws, Board policies, Board rosters and membership directories; minutes of Board meetings, annual meetings, and sporadic general membership meetings; financial reports relating to budgetary matters; newsletters; study reports based on intensive study of mostly local issues.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The Mansfield League of Women Voters ( MLWV) was organized in 1941 and is an affiliate of the national League of Women Voters (LWVUS). It is a non-profit political organization dedicated to encouraging informed and active participation in government and politics. The LWVUS and its state affiliates do not support or oppose candidates or political parties. However, they do take positions on issues and work to advance these positions. Support of positions is determined through membership consensus after objective study.

To encourage participation in government the MLWV conducts voter registration drives, sponsors forums at which voters meet the candidates, and compiles and disseminates voter information. Publications on the process of government and various governmental issues are distributed to the public at no cost.

During the years since its founding members of the MLWV have worked on many national, state and local issues with notable success. Among the local achievements in which the informational studies and supportive actions of the MLWV have played a decisive role are:

list.item: Assisted-Living Housing for Aging, Moderate-Income Residents (in progress, Sept 2008)
Later High School Start Time (in progress, Sept 2008)
Publication and Distribution of Know Your Town Booklet

bioghist.p: Additional information about the Mansfield League of Women Voters is available on its website.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials that compose the records of the Mansfield League of Women Voters (MLWV) in this collection begin with minutes documenting a meeting that took place on 5 February 1942. As the MLWV gained strength in membership and purpose the records of its activities have included: organizational documents such as histories of the League, by-laws, Board policies, Board rosters and membership directories; minutes of Board meetings, annual meetings, and sporadic general membership meetings; financial reports relating to budgetary matters; newsletters; study reports based on intensive study of mostly local issues.

The relative completeness of these records reflects what has been made available to this collection from many current and past members of the MLWV. Additional materials of both a historic and current nature will be added as they become available.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series I. Organizational Records ( undated, 1946-2009) contains general records of the organization and documentation of several significant committees and activities. Please note that "Know Your Town Fair" changed to "Know Your Towns Fair" in 2006.
Series II. Minutes ( 1942-2008) contains minutes and reports of annual, board and general meetings. The dates for this series are inclusive and do not indicate those that are missing.
Series III. Studies and Positions ( undated, 1951-2009) contains the research, notes, references and working papers of the League study groups.
Series IV. Programs ( undated, 1975-2009) includes documentation of occasional programs organized, presented and/or sponsored by the MLWV.
Series V: Scrapbooks ( 1950-2003) documents the activities and interests of the organization organized chronologically.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of materials pertaining to Connecticut organizations, history and politics. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the reference desk.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: The following materials have been separated from the collection and cataloged:
Did My Vote Really Count on 11/4? 2005-0159.dvd1

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on this collection with the exception of Membership materials. The Membership lists/directories/rosters for the most recent ten years are available only to members of the MLWV.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from these Papers must be obtained in writing from both the University of Connecticut Libraries and the owner(s) of the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item description, #:#], Mansfield League of Women Voters Records. Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Dodd Research Center was selected as the official repository for the Mansfield LWV records in 2005. Materials have been added irregularly since November 2005.
